file_content.text: Nice landing. Let's take a look.
Solid body, not a scratch on her... and she came with my shuttle. What's her name?
Ensign Raina Temple, sir. Chiss Expansionary Defense Force.
Of course. Minder Seventeen, Imperial Intelligence. Excellent work, both of you.
I couldn't have done any of this without her.
Temple's help was invaluable.
High praise. Maybe she deserves a promotion.
Thank you, sir.
I brought you the Starbreeze, "Minder." Are we through?
Enough of the pleasantries.
I'll fly the shuttle to its final destination. You can take my ride home.
Ensign, why don't you and Kaliyo run a systems check--I need a minute with the agent.
Ensign, why don't you and Vector run a systems check--I need a minute with the agent.
Ensign, why don't you go run a systems check--I need a minute with the agent.
I'll chisel the ice off the pilot seat for you.
Ardun Kothe'll be happy. But the girl... we agree she needs to die, right?
That's unnecessary. She knows better than to reveal classified intelligence.
She's no threat to us.
Maybe. I like to be careful.
I don't understand.
She's Imperial, she knows about the Starbreeze, she's seen me, she's seen you....
She can be dangerous. Let me handle it.
Consider it dealt with.
Don't expect me to buy that.
Look, you've worked with her, you've bonded with her--fine, I'm not heartless. Maybe she'll even be useful.
You want her to live, you take responsibility. Stash her on your ship. She doesn't talk to anyone; doesn't learn about the SIS.
I guarantee she won't be a problem.
If I have to, I can do it.
What sort of person would subject her to that?
You want her to be a prisoner?
A merciful one?
Just to be sure, though, I'm putting a command in your brain. Keyword onomatophobia.
If Raina Temple becomes a threat to our mission or leaves your supervision, you will kill her. You won't have a choice.
Sorry I didn't meet your friend--I must have taken a wrong turn.
Sir. Minder Seventeen told me about the transfer. I'm... a little surprised.
If Intelligence wants me out of the Chiss Defense Force, though, I won't argue. Nice as it would've been to pack an overnight bag.
You'll fit right in, Ensign. You shouldn't worry.
It's great to have you.
I know it's sudden. You'll have to manage as best you can.
I'm sorry about this.
Don't get me wrong, it's a fantastic opportunity. My father would love this.
But if I can ask... why do you want me here?
Maybe I just like having a woman like you around.
[Flirt] I enjoy your company.
What can I say? I could use a decent partner.
You're good company.
I'm sure that's true, but if you won't tell me the full reason, just say so.
If it were up to me, you'd stay on Hoth. But my superiors insisted.
You were forced on me.
Understood, sir.
But if I can ask... why do your superiors want me on your team?
You're versatile, capable and young enough to learn. You could be a brilliant operative.
You have Cipher potential.
Really? Well, maybe it's time for a career change after all.
You have strength in the Force. Trained or not, that makes you useful.
There's Sith power in you.
Lord Jadus's decree? Still better than execution; I'll do what you say.
Maybe it's time I faced that fact.
First lesson, Ensign: Learn to keep your mouth shut.
No more questions.
Yes, sir.
You're cute. We're going to a cantina, and you're getting me so many free drinks....
I'll try to earn my keep?
Hey, agent! I'm grabbing this ride; race you back to the ship.
Ensign? We're delighted that you're joining us. Don't let the dangers put you off.
That's very kind, Master Hyllus.
Just "Vector."
We'll let you two get acquainted and meet you back on the ship. Take care of her.
Doctor Eckard Lokin. We should swap stories about your father.
You know my father?
Forgive me. Cipher, I'm afraid the cold's starting to get to me--I'll meet you both back on the ship.
Code name Legate to Hunter. I have located the Starbreeze.
You look like hell--fiery as always.
I owe command ten credits. You look awful, by the way.
Get that shuttle running and rendezvous at these coordinates. Hunter out.
No choice. Complete the mission, obey the command. Wait for an opportunity.
You keep talking to me, but I don't know what you are.
Who are you?
I don't need a voice in my head taunting me. Go away.
You're starting to annoy me.
[Ignore the voice]
Sir! Pirates are down, but I'm the only one left. We need to get moving.
Come on. Let's get this ship off the ground.
Help me with this shuttle.
I'll do what I can. I don't think flying that thing will be easy...
Are you hurt?
Scratches, sir. Deep scratches. Force trick saved my life.
Come on. You want to fly that shuttle, you'll need a copilot. And I don't think there's another way out.
You'll have to find your own way out. Where I'm going is classified.
I can't take you aboard.
Sir, I don't--I won't last very long here. I can keep my eyes shut.
Hate to say it, but we'll need help flying this thing. Half the systems are frozen.
The shuttle is in poor condition--we'll need help to fly it.
If we're in any hurry, I don't think we can get this thing off the ground without help.
Besides, you'll need a copilot. That shuttle looks like it's about to fall apart.
We'll discuss this later--get inside the Starbreeze, now.
Fine--get on board.
You can help, but you don't repeat anything you see. Understand?
This is all confidential.
Understood, sir.
Obey or else, Ensign.
I was born Imperial, sir. I know how to take orders.
This is Hunter to Legate. Hope you weren't getting lonely--I'm on-planet, but signals don't carry here.
Ardun Kothe authorized me to take your reins. Have you found the Starbreeze yet?
I haven't seen you since Nar Shaddaa. How's the rest of the team?
It's been a while, SIS man...
If you want this done right, I need time. Uninterrupted time.
Don't rush me.
You didn't answer my question. Now I'm going to have to force you.
Keyword onomatophobia. Command: Deliver your mission report.
All right...
Are you brainwashing me?
You're a sick man.
I am attempting to locate Admiral Davos, who will lead us to the Starbreeze.
Good. Obedience comes easier when you don't have a choice.
Contact me as soon as you find the shuttle. Hunter out.
Smart. Arrogant. Cautious. Don't underestimate him.
Admiral Davos has gone rogue. I can't get the Starbreeze until I track him down.
There's been a complication.
I hope you're not dragging your feet. Let's take out some insurance.
Keyword onomatophobia. Command: Find the Starbreeze and contact me when you succeed.
That wasn't necessary!
I will.
You're a sick man.
Orders understood. I'll proceed with the mission.
Good. Master Kothe thinks you work better without your programming. I'm not so soft.
Hunter out.
Why don't you come talk another time?
She knows too much. We execute her.
Of course I agree.
Imperial efficiency. Well, bring her out--might as well get the job done now.
Better to kill her now.
You don't need me to do the dirty work.
You should do it yourself.
No, I don't. I need you to understand your job.
Ensign? Can you come out here?
All right. I'll kill her.
Sir?
Take a look at the external landing controls. I think they're jammed.
There is a lot of carbon scoring....
Who would've guessed we'd make such a good team?
Goodbye, agent. Always a pleasure.
Ensign hit her head on a blaster bolt, huh? Bet her body'll be out here for years....
She seemed kind. When the mission is over, we'll make sure her death is recorded.
I thought it best he didn't see my face. Pity the ensign wasn't so cautious.
You're playing games with us!
